name: oj-data-grid

styleClasses.description: Use this class on cells' and headers' className property to align your content horizontally. By default the alignment is flex-end on cells and varies on headers, see other possibilities in the [Flex Layout]{@link FlexLayout} justify section for size and flexjustify options.

Use this class on cells' and headers' className property to align your content vertically. By default the alignment is center on cells and headers, see other possibilities in the [Flex Layout]{@link FlexLayout} align section for size and flexalign options.

Direction can be left or right. Use this class on cells' and headers' className align your content horizontally to the left or right. See the [Helpers]{@link Helpers} section for details. This handles the always one direction case that flexjustify does not.
Used to style a datagrid cell so that it has no padding.
Used to style a datagrid cell so that it has the default padding.

Used to style the default header widths and heights. By default the datagrid supports up to depth 7. If you have headers width depth greater than 7 specify the defaults using the class name description or use apply custom style rules to the headers.

description: Displays data in a cell oriented grid.

bandingInterval.description: Specifies the data body row and column banding intervals.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to cells.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the cell.

style.description: Inline style to add to the cells.

currentCell.description: Specifies the grid's currently focused cell.

type.description: designates whether a header or databody cell is the current cell, valid values are: 'cell', 'header', 'label'

axis.description: header axis, available if type is header or label, valid values are: 'row', 'column', 'rowEnd', 'columnEnd'

index.description: header index, available if type is header

level.description: header level, available if type is header or label

key.description: header key, available if type is header

indexes.description: cell indexes, available if type is cell

keys.description: cell keys, available if type is cell

dnd.description: Specifies the drag and drop row reordering.

row.description: row reordering within the DataGrid, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

editMode.description: Specifies if the grid is read-only or editable.

cellEdit.description: the DataGrid cells are individually tabbable and editable

cellNavigation.description: the DataGrid is a single tab stop and editable at the cell level, but currently read only

gridlines.description: Specifies the visibility of the grid body vertical and horizontal gridlines.

column.description: Specifies attributes on the column headers.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to column headers.

label.description: Specifies attributes on the column header labels.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to column header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the column header labels.

style.description: Inline style to apply to column header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the column headers.

resizable.description: Specifies resizing width or height on the column headers.

width.description: column width resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

height.description: column header height resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

sortable.description: Specifies whether sorting is enabled on the column headers.

auto.description: get the sortable property from the data source

style.description: Inline style to add to the column headers.

columnEnd.description: Specifies attributes on the column end headers.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to column end headers.

label.description: Specifies attributes on the columnEnd header labels.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to columnEnd header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the columnEnd header labels.

style.description: Inline style to apply to columnEnd header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the column end headers.

resizable.description: Specifies resizing width or height on the column end headers.

width.description: columnEnd width resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

height.description: columnEnd header height resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

style.description: Inline style to add to the column end headers.

row.description: Specifies attributes on the row headers.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to row headers.

label.description: Specifies attributes on the row header labels.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to row header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the row header labels.

style.description: Inline style to apply to row header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the row headers.

resizable.description: Specifies resizing width or height on the row headers.

width.description: row width resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

height.description: row header height resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

sortable.description: Specifies whether sorting is enabled on the row headers.

auto.description: get the sortable property from the data source

style.description: Inline style to add to the row headers.

rowEnd.description: Specifies attributes on the row end headers.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to row end headers.

label.description: Specifies attributes on the rowEnd header labels.

className.description: CSS class names to apply to rowEnd header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the rowEnd header labels.

style.description: Inline style to apply to rowEnd header labels.

renderer.description: Specifies what renders is the row end headers.

resizable.description: Specifies resizing width or height on the row end headers.

width.description: rowEnd width resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

height.description: rowEnd header height resizable, valid values are: 'enable', 'disable'

style.description: Inline style to add to the row end headers.

auto.description: the DataGrid will decide the scroll policy

loadMoreOnScroll.description: additional data are fetched when the user scrolls to the bottom of the DataGrid and all previous data are kept in the DOM

scroll.description: virtual scrolling is used meaning only rows/columns visible in the viewport are fetched and kept in the DOM

scrollPolicyOptions.description: Gets and sets the fetch options for scrolling behaviors that triggers data fetches.

maxRowCount.description: The maximum total number of rows to fetch, -1 is unbounded

maxColumnCount.description: The maximum total number of columns to fetch, -1 is unbounded

scrollPosition.description: Gets and sets the scroll position of the data grid.

rowIndex.description: the zero-based row index of the cell at the origin of the grid. If scrollPolicy is set to 'loadMoreOnScroll' and the index is greater than maxCount set in scrollPolicyOptions, then it will scroll and fetch until the end of the list is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

columnIndex.description: the zero-based column index of the cell at the origin of the grid. If scrollPolicy is set to 'loadMoreOnScroll' and the index is greater than maxCount set in scrollPolicyOptions, then it will scroll and fetch until the end of the list is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

rowKey.description: the row key of the cell at the origin of the grid. If DataGridDataSource is used for data and the key does not exist in the DataGridDataSource, then the value is ignored. If it is unknown in the data source then the grid will fetch and scroll until the item is found or the end of the axis is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

columnKey.description: the column key of the cell at the origin of the grid. If DataGridDataSource is used for data and the key does not exist in the DataGridDataSource, then the value is ignored. If it is unknown in the data source then the grid will fetch and scroll until the item is found or the end of the axis is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

offsetX.description: the horizontal offset in pixel relative to the cell identified by key/index.

offsetY.description: the vertical offset in pixel relative to the cell identified by key/index.

row.description: set row selection mode, valid values are: 'none', 'single', 'multiple'

cell.description: set cell selection mode, valid values are: 'none', 'single', 'multiple'

translations.description:
A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this
component has no resources. Resources may be accessed and overridden individually or collectively, as seen in the examples. If the component does not contain any translatable resource, the default value of this attribute will be 
null. If not, an object containing all resources relevant to the component.

If this component has translations, their documentation immediately follows this doc entry.

accessibleActionableMode.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context to enter actionable mode.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleColumnContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the column index.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleColumnEndHeaderContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the column end header index.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleColumnHeaderContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the column header index.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleColumnSelected.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context when a column is selected.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleColumnSpanContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the cell column extent/span.

See the translations option for usage examples.

accessibleFirstColumn.description:

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleMultiCellSelected.description:

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleNavigationMode.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context to enter navigation mode.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRangeSelectModeOff.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for discontinuous selection off.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRangeSelectModeOn.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for discontinuous selection on.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowCollapsed.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context when a row is collapsed.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the row index.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowEndHeaderContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the row end header index.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowExpanded.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context when a row is expanded.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowHeaderContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the row header index.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowSelected.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context when a row is selected.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleRowSpanContext.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the cell extent/span.

See the translations option for usage examples.

accessibleSelectionAffordanceBottom.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the bottom selection affordance on touch device.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleSelectionAffordanceTop.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context for the top selection affordance on touch devices.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleSortAscending.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible text when a header is sorted ascending.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleSortDescending.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible text when a header is sorted descending.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleStateSelected.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context when an item has been selected.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleSummaryEstimate.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context read when the exact row and column count are unknown.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleSummaryExact.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context read when the exact row and column count are known.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

accessibleSummaryExpanded.description:
Provides properties to customize the accesible context reading out the total number
of rows expanded inside the data grid.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelCut.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu cut label for row reordering.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelDisableNonContiguous.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu label for exiting non-contigous selection.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelEnableNonContiguous.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu label for entering non-contigous selection.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelPaste.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu paste label for row reordering.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelResize.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu resize label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelResizeDialogSubmit.description:
Provides properties to customize the resize dialog submit button.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelResizeHeight.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu resize height label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelResizeWidth.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu resize width label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelSortCol.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu sort column label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelSortColAsc.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu sort column ascending label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelSortColDsc.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu sort column descending label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelSortRow.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu sort row label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelSortRowAsc.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu sort row ascending label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelSortRowDsc.description:
Provides properties to customize the context menu sort row descending label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgFetchingData.description:
Provides properties to customize the text when fetching data.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgNoData.description:
Provides properties to customize the empty data grid text.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

refresh.description: Redraw the entire data grid after having made some external modifications.

getContextByNode.description: Returns an object with context for the given child DOM node. This will always contain the subid for the node, defined as the 'subId' property on the context object. Additional element specific information may also be included. For more details on returned objects, see context objects.

setProperty.description:
Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component
of the change, triggering a [property]Changed event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

getProperty.description: Retrieves a value for a property or a single subproperty for complex properties.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

setProperties.description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

ojResize.description: Triggered when a portion of the DataGrid is resized

header.description: the key of the header which was resized

width.description: the old pixel size (ex: '75px' would be 75)

height.description: the old pixel size (ex: '75px' would be 75)

width.description: the new pixel size (ex: '75px' would be 75)

height.description: the new pixel size (ex: '75px' would be 75)

ojSort.description: Triggered when a sort is performed on the DataGrid

header.description: the key of the header which was sorted on

direction.description: the direction of the sort ascending/descending

ojScroll.description: Triggered after the DataGrid has been scrolled via the UI or the scrollTo method.

scrollX.description: the x position in pixels of the scrollable region calculated from the origin of the DataGrid. In RTL this would be the right of the grid.

scrollY.description: the y position in pixels of the scrollable region

ojBeforeCurrentCell.description: Triggered before the current cell is changed via the currentCell attribute or via the UI.

currentCell.description: the new current cell, see currentCell for the object information

previousCurrentCell.description: the previous current cell, see currentCell for the object information

ojBeforeEdit.description: Triggered before the DataGrid is going to enter edit mode. To prevent editing the cell prevent default on the event.

cellContext.description: the cellContext of the cell that editing is going to be performed on

ojBeforeEditEnd.description: Triggered before the DataGrid is going to exit edit mode. To prevent exit editing the prevent default on the event. There is a provided beforeEditEnd function, oj.DataCollectionEditUtils.basicHandleEditEnd, which can be specified. This function will handle canceling edits as well as invoking validation on input elements.

cellContext.description: the cellContext of the cell that editing is going to be performed on

cancelEdit.description: true if the edit should be negated based on actions (i.e. escape key)

contextMenu.description:
The contextMenu slot is set on the oj-menu within this element. 
This is used to designate the JET Menu that this component should launch as a context menu on right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific gesture. 
If specified, the browser's native context menu will be replaced by the JET Menu specified in this slot.

The application can register a listener for the Menu's ojBeforeOpen event. The listener can cancel the launch via event.preventDefault(), 
or it can customize the menu contents by editing the menu DOM directly, and then calling refresh() on the Menu.

To help determine whether it's appropriate to cancel the launch or customize the menu, the ojBeforeOpen listener can use component API's to determine which 
table cell, chart item, etc., is the target of the context menu. See the JSDoc and demos of the individual components for details. 

Keep in mind that any such logic must work whether the context menu was launched via right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific touch gesture.
